2312020.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312020
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 001
2312020.text: Hudhayfa said, "When the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, wanted to go to sleep, he said, 'By Your Name, O Allah, I die and live.' When he woke up, he said, 'Praise be to Allah who gave us life after He made us die, and to Him is the gathering.'"

2312030.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312030
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 002
2312030.text: Anas said, "When the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went to bed, he said, 'Praise be to Allah who has given us food and drink, and given us enough and given us refuge. How many people have neither enough nor refuge!'"

2312040.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312040
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 003
2312040.text: Jabir said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, did not sleep until he had recited, 'Alif-Lam-Mim. The Sending-down' (32) and 'Blessed is the One in whose hand the kingdom is' (67).'"

2312050.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312050
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 004
2312050.text: 'Abdullah said, "Going to sleep during dhikr comes from Shaytan. if you like, you can put it to the test. When one of you goes to bed and wants to go to sleep. he should mention Allah Almighty."

2312060.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312060
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 005
2312060.text: Jabir said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, did not go to sleep until he had recited 'Blessed' (67) and 'Alif-Lam-Mim. The Sending-down' (32)."

2312070.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312070
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 006
2312070.text: Abu Hurayra said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'When one of you goes to bed, he should undo the inside of his lower garment and dust the bed with it. He does not know what has come on his bed since he left it. He should lie down on his right side and say, 'In Your Name I have laid down on my side. If You take my soul, then have mercy on it. If You release it, then preserve it in the manner in which You preserve the men of right action."

2312080.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312080
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 007
2312080.text: Al-Bara' ibn 'Azib said, "When the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went to bed, he laid down on his right side. Then he said, 'O Allah, I have turned my face to You and I have surrendered my self to You and I have committed my back to You out of fear and desire for You. There is no place of safety or refuge from You except with You. I have believed in Your book which You revealed and Your Prophet whom You sent.' He said, 'Whoever says it at night and then dies, dies in fitra (natural state).'"

2312090.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312090
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 008
2312090.text: Abu Hurayra said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say when he went to bed, 'O Allah, Lord of the heavens and the earth, and Lord of all things, Splitter of the grain and seeds, the One who sent down the Torah, the Gospel and the Qur'an! I seek refuge with You from every evil. You take by the forelock. You are the Outward, and there is nothing above You. You are the Inward and there is nothing below You. Pay my debts for me and keep me safe from poverty.'"

2312110.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312110
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 010
2312110.text: "When a man enters his house or goes to bed, an angel and shaytan hasten to him. The angel says, 'Seal it with good!' The Shaytan says, 'Seal it with evil.' If he praises Allah and remembers Him, he chases the shaytan away and spends the night with him guarding him. When he wakes up, the angel and shaytan hasten to him and say the same thing. If he mentions Allah and says, 'Praise be to Allah, who keeps firm hold of the heavens and earth, preventing them from vanishing away. And if they vanished no one could then keep hold of them. Certainly He is Most Forbearing, Ever-Forgiving.' (35:41) Praise be to Allah who holds back the sky preventing it from falling on the earth, except by His permission. Allah is All-Compassionate to mankind, Most Merciful.' (22:63) If he dies, he dies a martyr, If he gets up and prays, he prays in virtue.'"

2312120.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312120
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 011
2312120.text: Al-Bara' said, "When the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, wanted to go to sleep, he put his hand under his right cheek and said, 'O Allah, protect me from Your punishment on the Day you raise up Your slaves.'"

2312130.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312130
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 012
2312130.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "If a Muslim man persists in two actions, he will enter the Garden. They are easy, but those who do them are few.' He was asked, 'What are they, may Allah bless him and grant him peace?' He said, 'That you say "Allahu akbar" ten times, "al-hamdu lillah" ten times, and "Subhana'llah" ten times after every prayer. That is 150 on the tongue and 1500 in the balance.' I saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, counting them with his hand. Then he said, 'When you go to bed, you should say, "Subhana'llah", "al-hamdu lillah", and "Allahu akbar". That is 100 on the tongue and 1000 in the balance. Who among you can do 2500 bad actions morning and night?' He was asked, 'Messenger of Allah, how is it that they are not counted?' He said, 'Shaytan comes to one of you while he is praying and reminds him of something he has to do such-and-such and such-and-such, so he does not remember to do it.'"

2312140.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312140
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 013
2312140.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When one of you goes to bed, he should dust his bed with the inside of his lower garment. he should say, 'In the Name of Allah.' He does not know what might have come on it after he left it. If he wants to lie down, he should lie down on his right side and say, 'Glory be to You, my Lord, I have laid down on my side by You and I raise it up by You. If you take my soul, then forgive it. If you release it, then guard over it as You guard over Your righteous slaves.'"

2312150.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312150
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 014
2312150.text: Rabi'a ibn Ka'b related, "I used to spend the night at the door of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and I would give him his wudu' water." He said, "After a long period of the night had passed, I heard him say, 'Allah hears whoever praises Him,' and I heard him say after a long period of the night had passed, 'Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds.'"

2312160.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312160
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 015
2312160.text: Ibn 'Abbas reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Whoever goes to sleep with grease on his hand before washing it off and is afflicted by something should not blame anyone except himself."

2312170.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312170
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 016
2312170.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Anyone who spends the night with grease on his hand and is afflicted by something should not blame anyone but himself."

2312180.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312180
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 017
2312180.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdullah reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Lock the doors, tie the water-skins, turn over the vessels, cover the vessels, and put out the lamps. Shaytan does not open a locked door, nor untie a water-skin, nor uncover a vessel. A mouse can cause a house to burn down with its inhabitants inside it."

2312190.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312190
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 018
2312190.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "A mouse came and began to drag the wick. The slavegirl moved to stop it. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'Leave it.' The mouse brought the wick and put it on the mat where he was sitting. It burned a hole in it the size of a dirham. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'When you go to sleep, put out the lights. Shaytan guides things like this and then they burn you.'"

2312200.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312200
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 019
2312200.text: Abu Sa'id said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, woke up one night and found that a mouse had taken the wick and climbed onto the roof with it to burn the house down over them. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, cursed it and it became lawful to kill it in the Haram."

2312210.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312210
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 020
2312210.text: Ibn 'Umar reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Do not leave the fire burning in your house when you go to sleep."

2312220.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312220
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 021
2312220.text: 'Umar said, "Fire is an enemy, so beware of it." He used to go around an put out the fires of his family before he went to sleep at night.

2312230.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312230
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 022
2312230.text: Ibn 'Umar heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "Do not leave a fire burning in your houses. It is an enemy."

2312240.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312240
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 023
2312240.text: Abu Musa said, "A house in Madina burned down with its inhabitants during the night. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was informed about that and said, 'Fire is your enemy. When you go to sleep, put out the fires.'"

2312250.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312250
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 024
2312250.text: Abu Mulayka related that when it rained, Ibn 'Abbas said, "Slavegirl! Bring out my saddle and bring my garment. Allah says, 'We sent down blessed water from the sky.' (50:9)"

2312260.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312260
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 025
2312260.text: Ibn 'Abbas reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, commanded that whips be hung up in houses.

2312270.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312270
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 026
2312270.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdullah said that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Beware of conversing after the night is still. None of you knows what creatures Allah will send, so lock your doors, tie up the water-skins, cover vessels and put out the lamps."

2312280.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2312280
In-book reference  : Book 50, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 50, Hadith 027
2312280.text: Jabir reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Keep children in until the evening has completely fallen. That time is the hour when the shaytans come out."
